private_information: You may move only disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
You act as agent_1 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi task
agent_1.goal: Contribute to reaching the global goal configuration by producing an ordered list of primitive moves limited to disks A-H.

private_information: You may move only disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O
You act as agent_2 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi task
agent_2.goal: Contribute to reaching the global goal configuration by producing an ordered list of primitive moves limited to disks I-O.

private_information: You coordinate and integrate the agents' move lists into a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent_1 and agent_2 move proposals into a consistent PDDL domain and problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance and is suitable for FastDownward.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
There are 15 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O with A the smallest and O the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg top-to-bottom A, C, E; right peg top-to-bottom B, D.
Tower of Hanoi rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; a disk can be placed only on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk.
Agent move permissions: agent_1 may move disks A-H; agent_2 may move disks I-O.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi problem. You may only move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Use the public information about the environment and the goal. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left, middle, or right. Each line must represent a single legal Tower of Hanoi move. Ensure every move you list respects the rule that a disk can only be placed on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk. Do not produce PDDL. Aim to propose only moves involving disks A-H and to contribute toward the global goal configuration.

You are agent_2 in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi problem. You may only move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Use the public information about the environment and the goal. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left, middle, or right. Each line must represent a single legal Tower of Hanoi move. Ensure every move you list respects the rule that a disk can only be placed on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk. Do not produce PDDL. Aim to propose only moves involving disks I-O and to contribute toward the global goal configuration.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the ordered primitive move lists proposed by agent_1 and agent_2. Your task is to integrate those lists, resolve ordering or naming ambiguities if any, enforce Tower of Hanoi legality across agents, and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for solving this instance with the FastDownward planner. Keep actions belonging to each agent distinct by naming actions for agent_1 with a prefix agent_1- and for agent_2 with a prefix agent_2-. The PDDL domain should encode disks, pegs, legal move preconditions and effects, and agent-specific action definitions. The PDDL problem should encode the initial configuration, the goal configuration, and any required objects. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the produced PDDL is compatible with FastDownward.

orchestrator.prompt: Integrate the provided agent move proposals into a single consistent PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global goal. Here is the public information you should use: There are three pegs left, middle, right; 15 disks labeled A through O with A smallest and O largest; initial left peg top-to-bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O and middle and right empty; goal left top-to-bottom F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O, middle top-to-bottom A,C,E, right top-to-bottom B,D. Here are the agent move lists you will receive: {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}.
